There's not much that can be said here to justify your actions, so why bother? Let's keep it short - these civilians are going to die and there's little they can do about it.

event.name: STOREEVENT_WEATHER_STUCK
event.text: You see a small, populated moon in the distance, though there appears to be no ships going to or from. Shall we approach it?

choice.text: Land on the moon and search for a store.

event.text: No ships attempt to stop you, so you land on a small platform near a small urban city. There's few people outside, but you assume finding a store won't be too difficult.
The small groups of aliens about are reluctant to talk to you, hurrying to their destinations. You catch wind of a conversation about a storm, though you don't know what to make of it.
It seems you escaped just in time. A cluster of asteroids passes by the moon, pelting the surface. Though it doesn't cause much damage, you'd likely have been stuck for a long time.

As you look through the store, a dark cloud descends on the planet. An asteroid storm has engulfed the moon, but luckily the bigger ones burn up before they hit the surface. Regardless, there is no option of leaving yet. You wait, and lose a considerable amount of time.
You look at little and quickly find a market, though business seems to be poor. The shopkeeper seems to be in a rush to lock up for the night, but he lets you look around briefly.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) The Slug senses distress among the citizens. He advises we hurry.

event.text: With the knowledge your Slug provides, you're able to gauge that an asteroid storm will strike soon. You quickly hurry into the store and get what you need and leave before the storm hits.
As you wait for the FTL drive to charge, you notice an asteroid storm approaching the moon. Good thing you decided not to approach.

event.name: STOREEVENT_FED_AUTO
event.text: An automated Federation supply drone is stationed here. A simple ID scan should grant you access to its vending mode.
The Auto-ship recognizes you as a registered Federation vessel and opens its trading menu.

choice.text: (Engi Crew) Access an additional Drone offer.
(Zoltan Crew) Access an additional Beam offer.
(Orchid Crew) Access an additional Missile offer.

event.text: As long as it's not full of Federation crew, nothing is going to stop you from ravaging this ship. Honestly, maybe even if it was full of crew, it wouldn't stop you.

event.name: STOREEVENT_FED_MARKET
event.text: A large civilian market has been established in this system. Allied Federation ships patrol the area to make sure Rebels and Pirates can't sneak in.

choice.text: Volunteer to stand guard for a while for pay.

event.text: The Federation soldiers are glad to take a break, and their command agrees to let you stand guard. Your shift will take one jump cycle, hopefully nothing bad happens.
Fortunately for you, no pirates or Rebels make a surprise visit during your shift. You collect your pay and prepare to leave.

Luck is not on your side today - a pirate vessel has arrived, and it is your duty to take care of them!
Luck is not on your side today - a Rebel ship has arrived, and it is your duty to take care of them!

event.name: STOREEVENT_FED_OUTPOSTDAMAGE
event.text: A friendly Federation outpost nearly hails you. "Good, a friendly face. We took some damage from a Rebel attack, nothing major but we need scrap for repairs. Would you like to trade?"
"That was awfully kind of you. Well now we don't need to worry about repairs, but more scrap never hurts regardless, right?"
"That was awfully kind of you. Well now we don't need to worry about repairs, but more scrap never hurts regardless, right?"
Nothing will stop you from being a merciless ravager of all you come across. Pity the next poor soul to come across you with anything less than an entire armada to protect themselves.

event.name: STOREEVENT_FED_NOTFREE
event.text: A Federation supply depot is set up on the nearby planet. They won't give anything away for free, but that doesn't mean they won't be open to trade.

choice.text: Hey, god damn it, we're a Federation ship. Give us stuff!

event.text: The owner of the station glares at you. "I don't know if you've noticed, but we're in the middle of a war. Nothing is free. No one gets special treatment. Best I can offer is a discount on fuel.

choice.text: No free services? You die today!

event.text: Your greed has no bounds. Another innocent life for the slaughter block in your unrelenting quest for wealth.

event.name: STOREEVENT_ENGI_THREAT
event.text: A message arrives: "Your scrap, ours. Our weapons for you." A Engi military vessel jumps in, their weapons armed. Seems unusually hostile!
You power up your weapons in response, and the Engi springs into action. Prepare for battle!

choice.text: Hold off - see what's going on.

event.text: The Engi holds back for a few moments, then powers down their weapons. "Apologies if Federation vessel was concerned. Early show of aggression critical for deterrence of pirate vessels." The Engi explain that they are merchants and offer to trade.

event.name: STOREEVENT_ENGI_SMITH
event.text: The Engi can do remarkable things with just a pile of scrap. The Engi dronesmith at the small market nearby is offering to craft Drone schematics for anyone willing to pay.

choice.text: (Engi Crew) Ask for some free drone parts.

event.text: You express your interest at the dronesmith business, and visit the market.
You express your interest at the dronesmith business, and visit the market.

event.name: STOREEVENT_ENGI_ENGINES
event.text: An Engi ship hails: "Engine upgrade necessary for travel home. Sale of equipment necessary for Engine upgrade."

choice.text: This is the perfect time to attack!

event.text: Unfortunately for these Engi, they won't be going home without going through you first.

choice.text: (Adv. Engines) Allow them to scan your engines to better optimize theirs.

event.text: "Gratitude. Upgrades will be cheaper: necessity of scrap still present. Purchasing items of merit to your vessel will provide further benefit to Engi cause."

choice.text: (LR Jump) Allow them to scan your engines to better optimize theirs.

event.name: STOREEVENT_ENGI_PESTER
event.text: Looks like you aren't the only ship at the nearby market - another Engi vessel looks to be trying to communicate, though for some reason the station seems... strangely unreceptive to their fellow nanite constructs.

"Cannot converse at present moment. Separatist vessel is attempting to communicate. Current objective: ignore until problem goes away. Could you confirm odds of Separatist occupation through evaluation?"

"Please ignore the [station] owner. Contrary to what he -might- tell you, I can guarantee: we are not a Separatist vessel." The other Engi, who looks to be freshly painted grey to match the other Engi, does his best to move his arms like a robot while speaking.

"Suspicions affirmed. Continuing to refuse entry to Separatist vessel." The Engi pay you in thanks, and you proceed to the store. On your way out however, the Separatist vessel attacks! The Engi provide backup with an ASB, but you won't be able to get out peacefully.

choice.text: Lie; These guys are definitely not Separatists.
(Harmony Crew) Convince the Engi these are not Separatists.

event.text: "Confirmation suggests prior theory was incorrect. Thank you for your evaluation." Now satisfied, the Engi allow the "not Separatists" in to trade. Realizing you must have vouched for them, the Separatists discreetly offer you a gift while browsing the marketplace.

choice.text: No thanks, we'll stick to shopping.

event.text: The owners of the store turn their lack-of-attention away from the vessel and focus on you. They briefly welcome you and show you where the goods are, then go back to ignoring the other ship.

choice.text: Ignore the other Engi ship and shop.

event.text: The owners of the store turn their lack-of-attention away from the vessel and focus on you. They briefly welcome you and show you where the goods are, then go back to ignoring the other ship.

"Confirmation suggests prior theory was incorrect. Thank you for your evaluation." Now satisfied, the Engi allow the "not Separatists" in to trade. Realizing you must have vouched for them, the Separatists discreetly offer you a gift while browsing the marketplace.

"Evaluation: inaccurate. Federation vessel suspected of lying or being very stupid. Punishment: death." A harsh punishment - but it seems to extend to the Separatist as well! An ASB shot nearly takes out their ship and the survivor climbs aboard yours, but now you have to get out of here!

event.name: STOREEVENT_ZOLTAN_MERCHANT
event.text: Civilian Zoltan ships aren't all too common anymore - most have joined the Military to help fight off the Duskbringers. The ship here however appears to be a well-to-do merchant.

choice.text: (Zoltan Crew) "Under military requisition act 84-B, we possess the right to collect a small tribute from all Ministry merchant vessels."

event.text: The merchant glares at your crew. "Yes, yes... 84-B..." The ship transfers over some supplies, but doesn't seem all too willing to trade anymore.

choice.text: (Duskbringer Crew) Antagonize the merchant for goods.

event.text: Unfortunately for you, the stereotype of Zoltans taking crap from noone applies to this ship as well. No one's getting anything out of them without a fight!
"Fascist scum, working aboard a Federation vessel. Oh the number of protocols this violates, not to mention the ethical quandries! Fine, take my goods. But the Ministry will hear of this!"

event.name: STOREEVENT_ZOLTAN_REPAIRS
event.text: You thought most of the Ministry's fleet was dedicated to fighting off Duskbringers, but apparently enough Zoltan ships, paired together with some Engi, have set up a supply outpost and market for Federation allies.

choice.text: Visit the Engi Repair platform first.

event.text: "Federation identification provides services free of cost. For premium service however: further payment will be required."
The Engi go to work on your hull. It's enough to keep you going for a while longer.
The Engi go to work on your hull. It's enough to keep you going for a while longer.
The Engi go to work on your hull. It's enough to keep you going for a while longer.

A Zoltan looks up at you from a thick manual in front of him. "If you're a Federation vessel, you're entitled to a free partial restock of supplies. If you require a full restock however, it'll cost you."
An automated Zoltan supply vessel comes by and delivers the resources.
An automated Zoltan supply vessel comes by and delivers the resources.
An automated Zoltan supply vessel comes by and delivers the resources.

event.name: STOREEVENT_ZOLTAN_MONK
event.text: The local market looks to be Zoltan run and well protected. Around it are several Monks collecting their pension as part of the clergy. One of the ship is trying to hail you.

choice.text: Ignore the Monks and visit the market.

event.text: "Oh please, good captain, would you be so kind as to spare just a small amount of scrap?"

choice.text: Give them a very small amount of scrap.

event.text: The Monk greedily scoops up the scrap and gives you a nasty look. You ignore him and move on to the store.

choice.text: Give them a generous amount of scrap.
(Monk Crew) "We are monks, just as you. There is nothing to be shared but good feelings."

event.text: Safe to say, the Zoltans don't appreciate your spontaneous attack. Though the Monks are stuck fighting you one on one, an ASB in the distance is firing on you!
The Monk scoops up the scrap metal, smiling wide at you, but says nothing more. Slightly annoyed, you move past and visit the store.

The Monk scoops up the scrap metal, smiling wide at you. "Oh, you are so generous, so kind! May your journeys be blessed!" Confused, you move past the monk, taking note of how much happier you suddenly feel.
The Monk gives you a nasty look and folds his robed arms, but says nothing. You move past and visit the store.

"Gah, curse you! You show no kindness to others. May your journeys be filled with ruin!" You brush the Monk's harsh words off as nonsense, but you notice you feel much gloomier as you approach the market...
The other Monk looks disappointed, but nods. "Yes, yes. Safe travels, brother."

"I was not aware we so openly joined Federation vessels. Perhaps it should allow our teachings to spread further than before? I think I shall come with you, a change of scenery could do me good, and I don't wish to return to those awful nebulas for much longer."

event.name: STOREEVENT_ZOLTAN_GUARDS
event.text: A lone Zoltan trading vessel awaits you at the beacon. Its crew sends you a simple message: "We have military goods available for sale."
As soon as you dock, a swarm of Zoltan military guards grab your crew and pin them to the ground. One of the guards pulls out a scanner and starts to analyze them.
Your crew push off the guards and draw your weapons. Looks like a fight is nigh!
You don't have anything to buy from them today.
The guards pull back satisfied. "Apologies captain. An increase in pirate activity in these sectors warrants suspicion. Your crew have been cleared, you will be permitted to shop here."
The guards pull back satisfied. "Apologies captain. An increase in pirate activity in these sectors warrants suspicion. Your crew have been cleared, you will be permitted to shop here."
The guards pull back, holding on to one of your crew. "This one here is a fugitive of the Zoltan Ministry. Turn them in and there will be no further consequences for your vessel or crew."
The Zoltan drag off your crew. "Against my better judgement, you will still be permitted to shop here. Do not let us catch you harboring fugitives again, understand?"

removeCrew.text: Your crew member cannot be cloned as they are not dead. A long life in Ministry prison awaits them now...

event.text: Your crew push off the guards and draw your weapons. Looks like a fight is nigh!

Your Zoltan slowly puts down their gun and speaks to the guards. At first their arguments don't seem to have an effect, but explaining the Federation needs all the help it can get - ANY kind of help - they seem to relent.

event.name: STOREEVENT_ORCHID_KERNELS
event.text: This beacon is an Orchid trade hub. Even though most of their equipment is made of plant matter, Orchids find some use for scrap metal as well, and are willing to trade for it.
Multiple Orchids wave to customers, trying to get their attention, while curious shoppers of various species look about.

choice.text: See what Kernel weapons they have for sale first.

event.text: A speckled Orchid walks you through a display of Kernel weaponry.
Multiple Orchids wave to customers, trying to get their attention, while curious shoppers of various species look about.

With the help of your crew, it doesn't take long to find another friendly Orchid ship who's willing to help out. He offers some missiles and repairs while you shop. Never underestimate the kindness of the plant-folk.
Looks like no one's eager in helping out the Orchids, though your attack sends the market into lockdown. No time to worry about that, you need to focus your sights on your new prey.

event.name: STOREEVENT_ORCHID_STATION
event.text: A giant Orchid trade station with military escort is located at the beacon. You'd hate to be on the bad side of these Orchids...
As you dock and enter the station, you can't help but notice how calm and silent it is inside.

choice.text: Take some time to relax here. The crew could use a rest.

event.text: You tour the halls of the station, and come across a lively tavern with all sorts inside. The banter seems to be entirely friendly, and it's the one source of vibrant sound in the entire place. You get to talking with a table of mercenaries who stopped here as well, and find yourself making a new friend!

choice.text: (Orchid Crew) Request help from the station owners with the fleet.

event.text: The Orchid in charge gruffly nods. He must know the implications of what going up against the fleet will mean - but it's a sacrifice for the good of the Federation and he's willing.

choice.text: We can't waste any time. Get to shopping.

event.text: You'll have all the time to rest once your mission is over or the giant Rebel death fleet behind you is gone. For now, you have things to do.
You disregard your previous thought. You'd love to be on the bad side of these Orchids, apparently. Your greed is rewarded by the additional fire of the military ship to deal with.

event.name: STOREEVENT_ORCHID_FIRE
event.text: As soon as you arrive at the nearby planet, you notice huge billows of smoke coming from a good half of the nearby market. An Orchid merchant hails you, looking fairly panicked. "D-don't worry about the fire. It's not a big deal. Come on in and shop!"

choice.text: Take a look at the market.
Offer to help with the fire.

event.text: "Oh... that's been ablaze for days. We've done all we can to supress it with what we have... which isn't much..."

Fortunately, your tech proves to be opportune in this situation. You manage to keep the fire contained to a smaller area of the market so the Orchids can take care of it. They pay you in thanks, and of course the marketplace is still open to be visited.

Fortunately, your crew proves to be opportune in this situation. You manage to keep the fire contained to a smaller area of the market so the Orchids can take care of it. They pay you in thanks, and of course the marketplace is still open to be visited.

Fortunately, your drone proves to be opportune in this situation. You manage to keep the fire contained to a smaller area of the market so the Orchids can take care of it. They pay you in thanks, and of course the marketplace is still open to be visited.

choice.text: (Orchid Crew) Send in your Orchid crew to put out the fire.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, the Clone Bay has already revived your floral friend. Whether he'll stay a friend is debatable, because he's currently scowling at you for your stupidity.

Nervously, you land as far away from the fire as possible and visit the store. Fortunately, when you return the fire has been contained to only two-thirds of the market place and your ship is fine.

event.name: STOREEVENT_ORCHID_FARM
event.text: A small, peaceful Orchid farm has been established nearby. It seems a bit strange to see plants growing plants, but you suppose it's no different to humans raising animals. Looks like they're selling off some of their old farming equipment, among other things.

choice.text: Look around at what they're selling.

event.text: You have no need for any of their special offers, you'll stick to shopping.

event.name: STOREEVENT_CRYSTAL_COLLECTOR
event.text: A rotund Crystalline being appears on the vid screen. "Aliens! A grand opportunity. I am a collector of the strange artifacts you call "scrap" and would love to trade!"

choice.text: Give him a gift of 40 scrap.

event.text: "So much scrap! A generous gift, but I cannot let this go unpaid! An exchange for a piece from my own heritage will do."

choice.text: (Scrap Arm) Show him how to construct a scrap arm.

event.text: "A device solely for the collection of precious metal material? Magnificent! I cannot let this go unpaid! An exchange for a piece from my own heritage will do."

choice.text: (Magnetic Arm) Show him how to construct a magnetic arm.

event.name: STOREEVENT_CRYSTAL_TRANSLATOR
event.text: Looks like you're receiving a transmission from a nearby Crystal ship, but it comes out heavily garbled. You don't have a clue as to what they're saying.

choice.text: Try and translate what he's saying.

event.text: You try for a while to decipher his message, but during the silence the Crystal pops back on, now speaking normally. "Apologies, I'm still accustomed to not having to use my translator. I'm a merchant vessel, would you care to trade?"

The two Crystals speak with each other, and the other one speaks again, now completely normal. "Apologies, I'm still accustomed to not having to use my translator. I was not expecting to see more of our kind aboard a Federation vessel! Well, I suppose it's not that strange. But still quite pleasant! I'm a merchant vessel, would you care to trade?" On top of the offer, he also throws in a show of good will because of your crew.
Miscommunication shmiscommunication. If you can't understand what they're saying, then everything they say could and probably is a threat. Best to just murder them without further questions.

event.name: STOREEVENT_CRYSTAL_WEAPONS
event.text: A Crystalline station is running a market here, selling Crystal weapons to travelers.

Apparently, the rampant savagery of the pirates and Rebels around you have gotten to you, driving you so far off the edge you've decided to open fire on a harmless Crystal station for next to no reason.

surrender.text: Looks like the pirates are surrendering and offering to liberate the Crystals in return for their continued survival.

choice.text: Nevermind it - just finish off the pirates.

destroyed.text: The station has been destroyed. Unfortunately for the slaves, it's unlikely anyone could have survived that explosion.

deadCrew.text: The pirates are all dead. Fortunately, the Crystals are still alive and able to be rescued.

event.name: STOREEVENT_CRYSTAL_PIRATES
event.text: Supposedly the nearby station is a Crystalline marketplace, but it looks suspiciously empty.
Hopefully the station's crew are all okay and you've just missed something, but you aren't willing to risk your own crew to find out.

You dock with the station and step aboard, and an alarm starts ringing almost immediately! A set of Crystal guards come to face you, but fortunately they're level headed enough to listen to your explanation. Looks like this is an ordinary market after-all!

You step aboard, only to find a band of pirates huddled around a garbage fire while a cage of Crystals look on in despair. As soon as you aproach, the pirates draw their guns. "Who the hell are you, identify yourself!"

choice.text: Calm down, we're here to trade.

event.text: You put down your laser, and the pirates cautiously stow theirs. "Alright. Lucky for you, this place is under new management. We got some... "workers" on sale too."

choice.text: We don't want your slaves. We're here for military goods.

event.text: "Ew, you're one of them ethical folk. Whatever, as long as I have scrap in my heap I'm not complaining."
"Are you a Federation captain or a pirate? Hah!" You ignore the laughing pirate and escort your new crew to the ship, then return to observe the market.
You won't stand for this! You open fire on the station.

event.name: STOREEVENT_FREEMANTIS_FREE
event.text: A Free Mantis vessel is here; always a pleasant sight for any Federation captain. Looks to be a merchant - what might he have in store?
"Oh captain captain! Shining skies bringing great blessings in our meeting here! You must accept gift, if you are wanting trade!"
"And now, buying of things may commence!"

choice.text: (Free Mantis Crew) Request an even greater gift.

event.text: "And now, buying of things may commence!"
"Awful awful captain! You anger me. You not accepting gift of friendship, then you are not friend nor living much longer!"

event.text: Looks like a Free Mantis market is nearby. Various Mantis chatter away about synthetic pheromones and other stereotypical Free Mantis things. One part of the market catches your eye in particular however - a vendor offering discounted resources.
"Good friends, I offering fuel of incredible value! Half off, buying them now while you can!"
"Most excellent of purchasings! Hoping you are enjoy."
"Most excellent of purchasings! Hoping you are enjoy."

"Oh? By how much so? I am forgetting standard prices..." You can probably get him to lower the price of one... but it's unlikely he'll be able to comprehend changing both. You have to pick your battles with these guys.

choice.text: Fuel is usually a lot cheaper.

event.text: "Ah, I am understanding now. Me thinking..."

None of the Mantis seem bothered by your presence, though they don't break out into crazed idolization either. Honestly, it's a relief.

event.name: STOREEVENT_FREEMANTIS_REPAIRS
event.text: A Free Mantis merchant nearby is broadcasting a looping advertisement; "We doing repairs! Come, discount price, we fix hull, we fix furniture, we fix broken marriage! Fixing anything! Come buy buy and buy!"
A Free Mantis mechanic eagerly waves at you to come in. Looks like they're selling some things on the side. To browse them though, you have to buy a repair job of some kind.

choice.text: (Free Mantis Crew) Request a free repair. [7$]

event.text: "Anything for brother and friend of Federation! Enjoying store!"

choice.text: Wait for your repair job to finish...

event.text: "Anything for Federation officer! Enjoying store!"

event.text: "Hoping you are happy with services, and enjoying store!"

event.name: STOREEVENT_MANTIS_RARE
event.text: Merchants are not highly respected among the Mantis race, so few undertake the profession. You're mildly surprised to receive an advertisement from a nearby space dock. Might be worth looking into?
"Hmmmh, you are seeming ally. Okay, I am trading with you. Making profit, rewarding as killing prey! Well, not as much. Death is very fun."
"The great Kazaaakplethkilik, coming in shop? Yes, this will do good publicity stunt! Business between killers, shall be very rewarding! Accept free sample of killing tool!"
You can never be sure when it might be a trap - and when it's a Mantis, the odds are pretty high.
"Heheh, you falling for trap! There not store here, only death!"
"You are in lucking day! Market open to all sorts! Come, participate in grand gesture of capitalistic adventure! Me am making profit today!"
"You are in lucking day! Market open to all sorts! Come, participate in grand gesture of capitalistic adventure! Me am making profit today!"

event.name: STOREEVENT_MANTIS_WHALE
event.text: A Mantis crew here has hunkered down in the abdomen of a long-dead space-whale - the only way, presumably, for them to operate their black-market trade without detection. Worth a look?
Your approach is met by a curious Mantis ship with distinct spikes of power in their weapons system. "Federation come to shut down? Refusal!"

choice.text: (Hive Mantis) We wish to shop here.
Well now that you mention it...

event.text: "We is not tolerating of this! We steal goods and sell goods fair and rectangle! Federation not take away right!"
"Gooood. And not letting door hit you on way out. Heh..."
It might not be such a good idea to go delving into a Mantis-run black market.
"Lying! I am knowing of it. For you, this earns disembowlment!"

event.name: STOREEVENT_MANTIS_WHALE_CONVINCE
event.text: "Hmph. Bad of mine, then. Come, we have extensive stock. Slave offerings, there."
No need for slaves today. You'll stick with regular goods.

event.name: STOREEVENT_MANTIS_WHALE_KAZ

No need for slaves today. You'll stick with regular goods.

surrender.text: The Mantis ship looks pretty beat up. Maybe you can convince them to stop now?

choice.text: If you're dead, we can't trade!
Nevermind it - just finish off the Mantis.

destroyed.text: The Mantis are now dead. That was indeed a fight to the death, though it's hard to trade with a corpse...

deadCrew.text: The Mantis are now dead. That was indeed a fight to the death, though it's hard to trade with a corpse...

event.name: STOREEVENT_MANTIS_DEATH
event.text: Looks like a Mantis trader is here. These are pretty hard to come by, and you wonder if he'll be willing to trade with a Federation vessel.

"Federation wanting trade!? Haha, I laugh! You wanting earn right to trade, then we fight to death!" The Mantis doesn't even give you time to explain that you can't trade if you're dead and attacks! Maybe if you beat them up a little, they'll listen?
The odds are not in your favor that this encounter would be friendly... better to stay way.

event.name: STOREEVENT_MANTIS_DEATH_TRADE
event.text: "Oh, hum. You are making many of senses. Okay, I am stopping."
"Yes, only fair. Am sending Engi to fix hull."

event.name: STOREEVENT_MANTIS_REBELS
event.text: The market nearby is broadcasting on Mantis frequencies, but all you see is a Rebel transport!
"Not Rebels any longer, this vessel belong to Hive! Rebel crew, now slaves. Slaves for you, if money you are having!"

choice.text: Just buy some stuff from the Rebel's stores.

event.text: You arm the guns and attack the Rebels, but on the other end all you hear is angry clicking... Looks like the Mantis are now in control of this ship!
You aren't sure what's going on here, but it's safest to not approach.

event.name: STOREEVENT_ROCK_RACIST
event.text: Rock traders are more common than you'd think, but they aren't always happy to deal with anyone. The ship here is no exception, and refuses to trade with you unless you pay a fee of ammunition.
The Rockman grunts and agrees to let you browse his wares.
You sure as hell aren't paying a fee to trade with some racist Rockmen. You'll just take what you want from their lifeless bodies instead!
The Rockman says nothing and flies away. A waste of a jump...

choice.text: (Faithful Rock Crew) Request to skip the fee.

event.text: "Ah, a fellow Rockman! Peculiar to see one of us aboard a Federation vessel... but I'm willing to be more generous to one of our own."

choice.text: (Zoltan Crew) Request to skip the fee.

event.text: "Ah, a Zoltan! I am intrigued to see what curiosities you might have to offer! Come in, browse my wares!"
Entering a hypnotic state, the Rockman welcomes you onboard and even pays you some scrap out of "kindness".

event.name: STOREEVENT_ROCK_MINELAUNCHERS
event.text: As soon as you jump in, the voice of a Rockman blares throughout your ship. "Visitors, come in and visit my brand new Mine Launcher Emporium! We sell Mine Launchers! And other things, because no one buys the god damn Mine Launchers! But please, buy my Mine Launchers!"
"Oh good, oh good! Visitors at last! Have you come to purchase a Mine Launcher? Oh please, my stock is expansive, endless even!"

You expect the Rockman to get offended, but instead he gets even more excited. "I found this a long time ago. I've been holding on to it for someone special. You're the first person to show any interest, so here you go!"
"I hope you enjoy it!" The Rockman claps with joy. You take a browse of the market as well on your way out.
The Rockman's voice suddenly turns cold. "Head left, you'll find the general marketplace..." He storms off, his thunderous footsteps shaking you as he goes.
Why are so many people adamant on selling these things still? They won't for much longer if you have a say in it!
The station continues to target you with a slue of enthusiastic advertisements, but you simply fly away.

event.name: STOREEVENT_ROCK_CRYSTALS
event.text: A collection of Rock vessels have gathered around a nearby planet. They look pretty invested in their trading, but you aren't sure how they'll receive you.

You land on the planet and find the Rockmen trading with each other, and various Crystal weapons are on display. Your approach seems to have upset them however, and a figure who looks to be some part of the Rock Clergy moves forward to interrogate you.
"Brother! Welcome! Come, take a look at all we have to offer. We have many holy items on sale!"
"Oh sweet lord, oh heavens, ohhhhhhhhh" The Rockman nearly collapses as he seems to enter some sort of state of prayer. The Rockmen shower you in gifts and offer to trade.
Intruding on the business of multiple Rock ships sounds like suicide. Better to not get involved.
"You expect us to hand over the shards of the holy Crystals to some... some common Federation filth? Unthinkable!" One of the Rock ships rises up to face you.

event.name: STOREEVENT_ROCK_CRYSTALS_TRADE_CONVINCE
event.text: The Rockman grunts. "You will be permitted to trade with us, but we refuse to let you have access to our Crystalline tech. It is too holy for Federation commons like you."
Apparently, the Rocks aren't having it. While most just ignore you, one particularly agitated vessel breaks off from the group to chase you!

event.name: STOREEVENT_ROCK_MISSION
event.text: The station here looks to be a Rock mission. These pop up from time to time to try and convert other species to the Rock religion. They're also usually accompanied by a market, but you aren't sure what they might expect from you in return.
You're stopped by a Rockman with a long staff, topped with the skull of a former-heretic. "Do you know the holy words? Are you pure? Prove yourself or face the might of the Inquisition!"
The Rockman laughs. "Then PROVE IT! Recite to me Rothedi 78:598."
The Rockman growls, and calls for security to chase you out of the station, while its weapons come online to fight you off.

Your Rockmen pauses, then lets out a massive release of flatulence, filling the room with an unbearable stench. You assume the missionary will be insulted, but instead he cheers. "You are a talented scholar of the holy texts! I am proud to have you aboard my station. Please, accept this gift."
Your Crystal giggles a little while they are lying, but the missionary doesn't seem to notice. Stricken by fear, he sends one of his fellow priests to join you while you're let into the market.

choice.text: (Unfaithful Rock Crew) "Your holy text are lies!"

event.text: The Rockman breaks into laughter. "HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHHAHAHAHAHAHAHHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAH... Hah... heh... hoooo... You are an ignorant idiot. Yet, you could be helped. I can reeducate you. Make you loyal to the Theocracy! I demand this if you want to access our market peacefully."

choice.text: Let them reeducate your Cultist to access the market.

event.text: "Good. They will become a follower once again. In the meantime, you may access the store. Try anything funny, and you won't see your crew ever again."

choice.text: Let them reeducate your Commando to access the market.

event.text: "Good. They will become a follower once again. In the meantime, you may access the store. Try anything funny, and you won't see your crew ever again."

choice.text: Let them reeducate your Outcast to access the market.

Terrified at the sight of the Lost Sun admiral, the missionaries submit immediately. Some of the less-convinced clergymen even revolt. They still offer to trade, but provide a gift for their newfound freedom as well.

The Rockman slinks back in fear as Vortigon takes a step forward. He takes the missionary into a different room, and when they return, the other is now wearing the blue robes of a cultist. You know better than to ask questions at this point, but fortunately it seems you can now trade here.
"Bahahaha! You think the Theocracy cares what the Federation demands of us? You hold no authority over our holy work! Get lost!" The station turns hostile!

The missionary chases after you, shouting. Unfortunately for him, as a Rockman, he's far too slow. However, a team of security officers have made their way onto your ship, and you'll have to take care of them before you can leave!
There's little moral quandary here, for Rock fanatics are feared across the galaxy for their brutal methods. You're only helping make this galaxy a safer place.
Rock fanatics are infamous for their brutality and merciless ways of forcing their religion on others. This isn't the kind of place you want to be shopping at.

event.name: STOREEVENT_REBEL_ANNOUNCER
event.text: You come across a large trade station. However, as soon as you approach a warning goes out to all ships in the region: "Do not associate with the Federation sympathizers. All who oppose the Rebels will be punished."

choice.text: Search among the stores to see if someone will sell to you.

event.text: You decide it's better to not push your luck and move on.

choice.text: (Engineer Crew) Pass yourself off as Rebels.

event.text: As a former Rebel themselves, your engineer has a few tricks up their sleeve for getting you into the market safely. You find a vendor willing to sell to you, though you can tell they have their suspicions.
You locate the source of the announcement and 'convince' the speaker to rescind his previous statement. Hopefully you will have enough time to shop before he can figure out what just happened.

choice.text: (Improved Mind Control) Alter the announcer's opinions.

event.text: You locate the source of the announcement and 'convince' the speaker to rescind his previous statement. In addition he apologizes by offering complimentary supplies. Hopefully you will have enough time to shop before he can figure out what just happened.

choice.text: (Advanced Mind Control) Alter the announcer's opinions.

event.text: You locate the source of the announcement and 'convince' the speaker to rescind his previous statement. In addition he apologizes by offering considerable complimentary supplies. Hopefully you will have enough time to shop before he can figure out what just happened.
You find a single store that responds to your hails: "Don't open any wide band channels. We'll sell to you but we don't want to draw attention to ourselves."
A suspicious vendor lets you in, and allows you to browse his store. Unfortunately, on your way out you can't help but feel you might not have gone as unnoticed as you had hoped...

Your search for a friendly marketplace yields no results but after a time a small shuttle approaches. They release some supplies in your direction with the message, "We are not all friends of the Rebel fleet. Stay strong."
You apparently spoke to the wrong person in your search for a store. Warnings go off and you detect an automated Rebel ship moving in to attack.

event.name: STOREEVENT_REBEL_XENOPHOBE
event.text: A looping message from a nearby store plays, "All are welcome to shop, with one stipulation. Xeno scum are forbidden to shop here! Humans only, or get lost!"

choice.text: We have no aliens, dock safely.
Try and dock despite having aliens aboard.
(Non-Sapient Crew) Pass off your alien crew as pets.

event.text: The store-owners consider for a bit, but seem to accept this, and allow you inside.
A racist market isn't something you're interested in shopping at.
Your approach doesn't go well. As soon as you get too close, a Rebel ship flies out from a hangar at the market and attacks!
Your approach doesn't go well. As soon as you get too close, a Rebel ship flies out from a hangar at the market and attacks!
Despite the warning, you dock with the station. It's clear you're breaking the law here, but the store owner says nothing. On your way out, he whispers "Speak to no one about this."

event.name: STOREEVENT_REBEL_FRIENDLY
event.text: A Rebel transport is making small repairs nearby, but they seem to be some kind of merchant. You expect a fight, but receive a secret hail. "Our military escort is still a few beacons behind, scattered by pirates. Truth be told, I think this war is silly. I'd be willing to trade, but we have to be quick."
The Rebel captain shrugs, and says nothing more. It's probably best you get out as quick as possible.

While shopping with the transport, suddenly an elite Rebel ship jumps in. This must be their escort. To your surprise, the transport turns on its military escort, and now you have additional firepower!
While shopping with the transport, suddenly a Rebel ship jumps in. This must be their escort. The transport pretends not to be involved and accuses you of attacking them, so the escort attacks!
You vanish, confusing the Rebels. You're able to sneak far enough away.
You step aboard the Rebel ship, somewhat cautious of a trap. Yet, nothing comes. You quickly take a look around and head out before their escort arrives.

event.name: STOREEVENT_REBEL_FRIENDLY_WIN
event.text: The escort is disposed of, but the Rebel captain seems shaken. "I... I'm on the wrong side. I won't do this any longer. Hurry up and buy whatever you need, I'm coming with you."

event.name: STOREEVENT_REBEL_ENGINEER
event.text: Rebel Engineers aren't always as aggressive as other Rebels, and fortunately it seems the one here is as you've heard. In fact, looks like they're looking to trade for the scrap needed to repair their Auto-ships.
The Engineers also offer a few drone schematics.
"Well if you aren't going to be helpful, then we'll just blow you up!"

surrender.text: Looks like you've caused some heavy damage to the ship's scanners, because suddenly it turns neutral, and enters vending mode for you.

event.name: STOREEVENT_AUTO_VENDER
event.text: Looks like an Auto-Vendor is nearby, but its programming won't let it trade with you unless you find a way to spoof it.

choice.text: Try and scan your fake ID.
(Engineer Crew) Rewire the Auto-ship to trade with you.

event.text: Fortunately, you're able to hack into the Auto-ship and reconfigure it to accept your Federation ID.

choice.text: (Hacking) Rewire the Auto-ship to trade with you.

event.text: Fortunately, you're able to hack into the Auto-ship and reconfigure it to accept your Federation ID.

choice.text: (Adv. Hacking) Rewire the Auto-ship to trade with you.

event.text: Fortunately, you're able to hack into the Auto-ship and reconfigure it to accept your Federation ID. You also leave a little present for the fleet, by setting the ship to explode when a Rebel ship communicates with it.
It's not worth the risk to try and trick an AI, you might as well get some scrap from it.
You have no interest in this Auto-vessel, so you decide to ignore it.
Looks like the Auto-ship isn't falling for it. As soon as you transmit your ID, the ship scans your own vessel instead, recognizes it as Federation, and attacks!

You can't believe it, but somehow you've tricked the Auto-ship! Unfortunately, scans later show that the ship was recording and transmitting the entire encounter. Looks like the fleet might have some new information on your whereabouts...
Somehow, you've tricked the Auto-ship into thinking you're not a Federation vessel. It opens up its virtual market for you.

event.name: STOREEVENT_DUSK_FRIENDLYISH
event.text: As Zoltan supremacists, the Duskbringers aren't keen on trading with anyone outside their species. Usually they don't get along with Ministry citizens either, but the ship here seems alright with dealing with any Zoltan, just not other races.
The Duskbringer captain seems pleased to see your crewmate, and ignores the rest of your crew.

choice.text: (Zoltan Shield) Submit yourself as a Zoltan ship.

event.text: It's not the most convincing alibi considering your vessel is registered under the Federation, but somehow you manage to gain access to the marketplace. You have to be careful not to let it be clear that your ship isn't quite what you claim.
The Duskbringers are your enemies. It doesn't matter if they're open to other Zoltan or not - they're still fascists and xenophobes, and that's enough in your book to warrant their death.
You aren't getting involved with the Duskbringers when you can help it.
You aren't getting involved with the Duskbringers when you can help it.
Looks like you didn't get away unnoticed - the Duskbringer vessel turns hostile and attacks!

event.name: STOREEVENT_DUSK_PROTOCOL
event.text: The Duskbringers are notorious for being even stricter than the Ministry. Looks like the station here is open to trading with anyone, a surprising find, but there's a million protocols in place.

choice.text: Take some time to learn the rules first.

event.text: It's mind-numbing reading through all of this nonsense, but at least you feel like you're finally confident enough to approach. Luckily, looks like you've done everything right. Hopefully this was worth it.

choice.text: (Zoltan Crew) Your crew understand the rules.

event.text: The Zoltan are raised to understand these kinds of things quickly. It only takes a minute of skimming the hundred page list of rules to understand everything you need to do, and fortunately their knowledge pays off.
You could care less if they don't mind trading with Feds. They're your enemies, and you'll be doing everyone but themselves a favor by killing them!
You aren't stupid. These rules are designed to trick up anyone who isn't a Duskbringer, and you won't fall for it.
By sheer, stupid luck, you get everything right. You'll be able to shop here safely now.

Looks like you've messed up, but it's not a disaster just yet. You're hailed, and a Duskbringer officer warns you that you descended a full centimeter below the allocated approaching space. If you don't want any problems, you'll have to pay a small fee.
You can tell by the tone of the Duskbringer he was looking forward to trouble, but you aren't giving him any. You don't mess up anything else, and are allowed inside.
The sudden excited attitude of the Duskbringer makes it clear this is what he was hoping for. Now prepare for battle!

It appears in your approach, you accidentally comitted a major felony. According the station's security, your angle of approach went over by exactly 2 degrees, rounded up. This being an unforgiveable crime, they sentence you to death immediately. This is unusually strict, even for the Zoltan, so you assume it's only made up to get you in a fight!

destroyed.text: "Critical failure. Orphan cryo-transport vessel; crippled. You are a monster." The Auto-vessel explodes, and various broken stasis chambers are ejected out into the abyss. Uhhhhh....

event.text: When you return to the Duskbringer, he's in a fit of laughter. "Oh, ohhhh, you should have seen your face! Hahahah! Those orphans, hahahahahah! Hah... but anyways, a deal is a deal."

event.name: STOREEVENT_DUSK_TAXES
event.text: A Duskbringer merchant hails you, seemingly very annoyed. "Federation? Pirate? I don't care. Damn Rebels deployed some stupid auto-tax collector in this system and it's driving me nuts. Kill it, and I'll trade with whoever you are."
Looks like this "tax collector" is a lot deadlier than you expected. You aren't even sure this thing IS a tax collector, but you want that store, so you'll do what you must.
The Duskbringer calls you a coward and cuts comms before you can respond.

event.name: STOREEVENT_COALITION_MYSTERYRACE
event.text: A Coalition merchant is present; quite the oddity considering these Federation-wannabes consist of perhaps the 4 most aggressive races in the galaxy. Except Slugs, but they aren't very nice either.

choice.text: Hail them, maybe we'll get lucky?

event.text: What kind of fool would you be to think you could get along with a Coalition ship anyways? You avoid the ship.
To your luck, the ship doesn't attack immediately! "Ssso, a Federation ssship? Truth be told, the Coalition isssn't quite what it wasss cracked up to be."

choice.text: Why not go and live a reclusive life away from the fighting?

event.text: "What, the life of a coward? Sssoundsss perfect for me! You're sssmart. Now, I wasss thinking to myssself why I would want to be talking to a Federation ssship, but now I'm glad I did." To your surprise, the merchant offers to trade!

choice.text: Why not go be a freelance warrior? That's better than the Coalition surely.

event.text: "The life of a warrior isssn't the life of a Ssslug! HAH! You're asss ignorant asss the resst of the Federation. Now, it'sss time I ssstop sslacking and do my job."

choice.text: You're just a puppet of the government like you were before.

event.text: "A puppet? Of the Kleptocracccy? Clearly, you know nothing about our sssociety. You're asss ignorant asss the resst of the Federation. Now, it'sss time I ssstop sslacking and do my job."
"Oh, sssso we got an edgelord over here. Pisss off! No one thinksss you're cool!"
To your luck, the ship doesn't attack immediately! "Federation ship? Truth be telling, Coalition not what cracking up to be..."

choice.text: Why not go and live a reclusive life away from the fighting?

event.text: "Haha, life of coward for Mantis? Ignorant meatsack know nothing of Mantis! You are dumb as other Federation meatsack, robots, green freaks, and rest! It time I do job, and disembowel you!"

choice.text: Why not go be a freelance warrior? That's better than the Coalition surely.

event.text: "Life of warrior, similar to this. Yet, freedom of hunt, sounding spectacular! You smarter than I. Thinking, why myself speaking to Federation ship? Now I knowing." To your surprise, the merchant offers to trade!"

choice.text: You're just a puppet of the government like you were before.

event.text: "Puppet of Hive? Ignorant meatsack know nothing of Mantis! You are dumb as other Federation meatsack, robots, green freaks, and rest! It time I do job, and disembowel you!"
"Hahahah, you are speaking like edgy teenager! Pessimism mindset of loser, not fine Mantis warrior!"
To your luck, the ship doesn't attack immediately! "Hmph. The Coalition is not what I expected. We do not fight for holy glory, only squabble..."

choice.text: Why not go and live a reclusive life away from the fighting?

event.text: "You expect me to turn my back to the holy texts, and go hide in a nebula? We Rockmen know more honor than that! You are foolish and naive, just like all the rest of the Federation. It is time we put you in your place."

choice.text: Why not go be a freelance warrior? That's better than the Coalition surely.

event.text: "A bounty hunter, a mercenary? You suggest I become a pirate?! We Rockmen know more honor than that! You are foolish and naive, just like all the rest of the Federation. It is time we put you in your place."

choice.text: You're just a puppet of the government like you were before.

event.text: The Rockman stops to contemplate. "You, you are right. No matter where I go, when the Theocracy banner flies, we shall never be free! I wondered why I let myself speak with a Federation ship, but now I am glad." To your surprise, the merchant offers to trade!"

"Misery is a fact of life, we must suffer to appease the gods. What do you gain for making aimless statements like this? Hah, nothing! You are a coward who shelters himself in pity. Stupid Federation."
To your luck, the ship doesn't attack immediately! "God, I never should have joined the Coalition. I was better off before being miserable and picking up trash in those damn asteroid fields."

choice.text: Why not go and live a reclusive life away from the fighting?

event.text: "And do what, go back to picking trash? No way man, that sucks! I changed my mind, the Coalition is better!"

choice.text: Why not go be a freelance warrior? That's better than the Coalition surely.

event.text: "And what, get hacked to bits like Oertiss? I want to get away from the fighting, not plunge myself into the thick of it! You Feds are clueless, maybe it's a good thing we want to get rid of you!"

choice.text: You're just a puppet of the government like you were before.

event.text: "What? Tyrdeo might be a pansy coward who collects song birds, but he's hardly intelligent enough to be a puppet master. I signed up for the Coalition willingly because I thought it was better than picking up trash. You Feds are clueless, maybe it's a good thing we want to get rid of you!"

"I couldn't have said it better myself. This place is hell. I don't even like the Coalition or the Republic. Why do I bother? Why the hell don't I just sell to a Federation ship? Does it matter? WHY DO I EXIST?!" The Leech captain starts sobbing, but you manage to convince him to sell to you as he mentioned.

event.name: STOREEVENT_COALITION_RACES
event.text: Looks like a trade-hub between the different races of the Coalition was set up here. You might be able to sneak in if you have any of the appropriate crew.
Thanks to your crew, it's not hard to gain access. You're even given a fresh Anti-Bio weapon on your way in!
Thanks to your crew, it's not hard to gain access. You're even given a fresh Missile weapon on your way in!
Thanks to your crew, it's not hard to gain access. You're even given a fresh Bomb weapon on your way in!
Thanks to your crew, it's not hard to gain access. You're even given a fresh Flak weapon on your way in!
It's a total waste, but you don't have anything to sneak in, and attacking the market would be suicide.

surrender.text: "Gah, alright you can ssssstop now! Jeezzzz! We'll trade with you, relax!"

event.text: The Coalition station turns off its weapons. You're still wary of trading with them, but you don't have many other options.

choice.text: Refuse and finish the station off.

event.name: STOREEVENT_COALITION_FORCE
event.text: Looks like there's a Coalition market here! As you could expect, they certainly aren't trading with you, a Federation ship, unless you can find some way of convincing them...
You hail the station, but before you can even get a word out, their Slug captain bursts out laughing. "HAHAHAHAHAH! No."

choice.text: Attack them, force is the only way to convince these guys.

event.text: If you can do enough damage to the station, you might be able to convince them to sell to you.
It might not be the greatest idea to try and make a Coalition station trade with you when they're your sworn enemies.

event.name: STOREEVENT_DYNASTY_NOAIR
event.text: It appears a small rogue planet is drifting through the system here. To you, it looks uninhabitable, but it looks like the Dynasty has set up a market on the surface. There's only one catch... there's nothing to support aerobic crew here.
Fortunately, your crew has come to save the day. You send them down to check out the market.
Fortunately, your respirators have come to save the day. You send down your crew to check out the market.
Fortunately, your crew has come to save the day. You send them down to check out the market. They got some odd looks, but no one protests.
Fortunately, your crew has come to save the day. You send them down to check out the market. They'll have to hurry, but you can't stick around too long anyways.
Fortunately, your crew has come to save the day. You send them down to check out the market. They'll have to hurry, but you can't stick around too long anyways.
Unfortunately, there's no way the Dynasty is going to make a special case for you. You'll have to do your shopping somewhere else.

event.name: STOREEVENT_DYNASTY_DOOMSDAY
event.text: "The Demons are coming! Are thou prepared? Most probably not! Stock up, gather your arms, and seek shelter before the demons come! Better yet, wander down to Ol' Yethredi's Doomsday and Demon Preparation Center, and purchase everything you need to keep yourself safe!"

choice.text: See what he has to offer.

event.text: "Come on in, come on in! There be many items to see, and keep no shyness! Yethredi has all the time! Well not particularly, because doomsday IS coming, but you get what I'm saying."
With no particular interest in the special items on display, you just take a look at the general shop.

choice.text: (Phantom Crew) Request that he help you with the fleet.

event.text: To your surprise, Yethredi is more than willing, despite the implications. "Doomsday approaches everfast. I fought the demons on the frontlines once, and many of my brothers I witnessed fall. When the time came, it was going to be my honor to stand one final fight against them. So yes, traveler, I will help you. I will help all of us. Reaper have mercy on our metaphorical souls."
Unfortunately for Ol' Yethredi, he's about to become the next victim in your unending spree of murders.
Not much point in sticking around. The 'demons' aren't anything new to you anyways, and Auto-ships are hardly a doomsday level threat to be preparing for.

destroyed.text: Despite the request of the Dynasty ship, you have blown up their station. They look furious, and begin to shoot at you before you can even pick up some wreckage.

deadCrew.text: The Vagabonds are now dead. True to their word, once back aboard their station the Phantoms reward you and offer to trade.

event.name: STOREEVENT_DYNASTY_CREWKILL
event.text: You receive a hail from a Dynasty ship orbiting a station nearby. Looks like they have an... unusual request for you.

"The times of prosperity have come along with your arrival. We find ourselves in an unusual and unfortunate position. Against better judgement we let Vagabonds aboard our station for trading. Now, they've taken siege of it, and we have been forced out. If you can kill them for us without destroying the station, we would be willing to trade."
"Exercise caution - we will not be pleased if there is no station for us to return to after this."

choice.text: (Vagabond Crew) Make a deal to trade with the vagabonds instead.

event.text: You decline the Dynasty ship's offer, then secretly dock with the station. The Vagabonds aboard are happy to see one of their own and offer to trade.
You have no idea what the offer is, but you have no business dealing with Ghosts.

event.name: STOREEVENT_SLUG_TRAP
event.text: A Slug transport ship is stationed near the beacon with a military escort ship. They message you, "We have been waiting for a customer for agesss. Care to see our waresss?"
"Oh well... We ssshall wait here then." You cautiously put distance between your ships before preparing to jump.
"Before we get ahead of ourssselves, I need to explain sssome ground ruless of our transsaction. Thesse are dangerouss timess, yess?"
"Firssst... We accept no tradesss, couponss or refundss. Purchasess are final. Underssstand?"
"We hold no liability for productsss damaged post ssale. We offer no insurance or customer sservice. Not a problem?"
"Fine... Not everyone appreciates good dealss..."

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Our Slug senses someone aboard the ship. Investigate it.

event.text: It looks like the merchant was trying to stall you while someone teleported on board. You catch him before he could finish and he teleports away. You expect a battle, but the merchant seems frightened more than anything. "I wasssn't doing anything! I was uh... bringing you a gift! Yessss! Please don't kill me, who'sss going to hoard my money otherwissse?"
"Great. Let me show you our waress. It's not often I meet patient alienss, have this complimentary fuel as well."
"Great. Let me show you our waress. It's not often I meet patient alienss, have this complimentary fuel as well."

"During our discussion, my man hass taken the liberty of disabling your weaponss to prevent any complications while completing our... transssaction..." You suddenly register multiple weapon locks, but your own weapons are not responding. Get out of there!
Your weapon system is restored to full power.
"Thank you. If you could do me one more courtesssy... please die quietly." You suddenly hear gunshots aboard the ship. He must have been stalling for time while they boarded your ship!
"Very well... Impatient alienss..." You prepare to jump.

You prepare to leave but notice noises in your ship. It looks like the merchant was trying to stall you while they hacked into your systems. You barely have time to order a red alert before a military ship flies through the clouds intent on your destruction!

event.name: STOREEVENT_SLUG_HYPNO
event.text: A huge Slug teleports from nowhere onto the bridge! Before you can open fire, he's spread his wares across the helm and is brandishing things at you.
As you approach, the Slug suddenly breaks out a pocket watch and waves it in front of you. "You will give me all of your money, and then you will drink the water in your toiletsssss. OooOoOOOooO!"
The Slug pauses, then continues to wave the watch. "Uh. You are going to give me all of your money, then play the Federation national anthem with your own flatulencccce!"

choice.text: No, I don't think I am.

event.text: The Slug growls. "YOU WILL GIVE ME ALL OF YOUR MONEY AND THEN YOU WILL DANCE LIKE A BALLERINA!"

choice.text: (Mind Control) Explain to him that hypnosis doesn't work with a watch.

event.text: "Oh. I need a machine for thisss? Well that'ssss lame. I need ssscrap to afford that... You have ssscrap, right? I have thingsss! We can trade!"

It seems like this Slug is some kind of hypnotist. It's not your Slug that told you that, it's the fact he is now brandishing an old pocket-watch and is waving it in front of you. When he realizes it's futile, he gives up and offers to trade.
You aren't sure if he meant well or not, but this Slug isn't taking this insult lightly. You'll have to chase him off with force, though hopefully that isn't too hard.
The Slug seems to give up. "Thisss never worksss. Whatever. Want to buy sssome ssstuff?"
The Slug seems to give up. "Thisss never worksss. Whatever. Want to buy sssome ssstuff?"
Furious it's not working, the Slug turns hostile and a Slug vessel comes swirling out of nowhere!

event.name: STOREEVENT_SLUG_ASTEROIDS
event.text: Looks like the nearby Slug colony is embedded on a large asteroid, somewhat unusual but nothing remarkable. The only thing is, this is a pretty dense field, and you aren't sure if you can make it through without harm.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Hail the colony and see if they can send a merchant to you.

event.text: Fortunately, the colony's managers are more agreeable than you would have thought. A ship is dispatched to trade with you.

choice.text: (Upg. Shields) Make your way through safely.

event.text: As the saying goes, it takes a brave person to set foot on a Slug colony - it can take weeks to get the mucus out of your clothes - but there's business to be done.

choice.text: (Upg. Engines) Make your way through safely.

event.text: As the saying goes, it takes a brave person to set foot on a Slug colony - it can take weeks to get the mucus out of your clothes - but there's business to be done.

choice.text: (Cognitive) Have your Cognitive chart a safe path through.

event.text: As the saying goes, it takes a brave person to set foot on a Slug colony - it can take weeks to get the mucus out of your clothes - but there's business to be done.

choice.text: (Upg. Autopilot) Make your way through safely.

event.text: As the saying goes, it takes a brave person to set foot on a Slug colony - it can take weeks to get the mucus out of your clothes - but there's business to be done.
Traveling through an asteroid field just to deal with some Slugs is the kind of choice only a captain dumber than you would make.

Your piloting skills are fortunately enough to carry you through to safety. No asteroids hit you, and you make both trips unharmed. As the saying goes, it takes a brave person to set foot on a Slug colony - it can take weeks to get the mucus out of your clothes - but there's business to be done.

You make your way to the colony just fine, but your journey back is rough. As the saying goes, it takes a brave person to set foot on a Slug colony - it can take weeks to get the mucus out of your clothes - but there's business to be done.

Your trip there and back are quite rough, but you've made it there in one piece (hopefully). As the saying goes, it takes a brave person to set foot on a Slug colony - it can take weeks to get the mucus out of your clothes - but there's business to be done.

event.name: STOREEVENT_SLUG_SHADY
event.text: The nearby Slug station is soliciting various (suspiciously) reasonably priced items. In fact, it seems so normal, that you're almost certain it's a trick.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Make all of your deals through your Slug.

event.text: Through the entire transaction, everything goes completely normal. Guess it was all a false alarm, though you're still cautiously poking through the cargo looking for stowaways or stolen goods.

choice.text: (Adv. Sensors) Keep an eye on the ship while you shop.

event.text: Despite your enhanced security through the entire transaction, everything goes completely normal. Guess it was all a false alarm, though you're still cautiously poking through the cargo looking for stowaways or stolen goods.

choice.text: (Upg. Doors) Lock down the ship while you shop.

event.text: Despite your enhanced security through the entire transaction, everything goes completely normal. Guess it was all a false alarm, though you're still cautiously poking through the cargo looking for stowaways or stolen goods.
You're the shoot first, ask questions later kind of guy. No questions will follow this time of course, it's just a metaphor. Happy murdering!
You know better than to let curiosity get the better of you. These Slugs can go fool someone else.
To your surprise, everything goes smoothly! No tricks, no traps, nothing! You're let into the store and take your time.
To your surprise, everything goes smoothly! No tricks, no traps, nothing! You're let into the store and take your time.

event.name: STOREEVENT_SLUG_SHADY_DOCK_LEAVE
event.text: As you attempt to leave, the station suddenly turns hostile! Seems about right that it actually was a trap after all.

event.name: STOREEVENT_LEECH_ASTEROIDS
event.text: It takes a brave merchant, regardless of your race, to construct a store so close to an asteroid field. Not that these Leeches seem to mind, considering their homeworld is already covered in far denser fields.

choice.text: (Defense Drone) Offer to let them duplicate your drone schematic.

event.text: The Leeches are grateful, as the defense drone will help make their questionable life choices slightly less questionable. They offer you some supplies for free.
The asteroid field might be deadly, but that won't stop you from being a public menace to everyone you come across!

event.name: STOREEVENT_LEECH_SCAVENGER
event.text: You guide yourself towards a decently sized scrapyard with a couple Leech mechanics working on disassembling various alien ships. The scrapyard owner hails you. "Need some parts? We got all kinds of junk here!"
You fork over your scrap to the Leech and hope you get something worthwhile.

choice.text: (Lanius Crew) Have your Lanius use their abilities on the metal.

event.text: Your Lanius melts the metal down and reforms it into individual components. Thanks to this, you're able to get a much larger yield of scrap than you spent here!
You aren't spending money to buy literal garbage. Not counting the fact that your money is quite literally garbage.
Looks like it's nothing but useless metal. You try and take anything you think might service for bartering to make back on your investment.
Seems the salvage contains a large amount of fuel, as well as some material that can be broken back down into scrap.
Seems the salvage contains a large amount of ammunition, as well as some material that can be broken back down into scrap.
Seems the salvage contains a large amount of drone parts, as well as some material that can be broken back down into scrap.
Seems the salvage conceals a hidden weapon cache! You pry it open and take out the weapon, which appears to still be functional.
Seems the salvage conceals a hidden drone cache! You pry it open and take out the drone, which appears to still be functional.

event.name: STOREEVENT_PIRATE_ODDSHOP
event.text: A very strange pirate market has been set up nearby. A small stream of traffic comes and goes, and it looks safe enough.

Inside the market is a rather odd scene. To the left is a booth selling likely extremely illegal Slug narcotics, to the right are several alien slaves kept in cages, and up ahead is a long slender pirate running what he calls the "Traveler's booth".
You step carefully around all the alien waste and you look at the various aliens in cages.

choice.text: Nothing here is of interest. Leave.

event.text: At the very least, the booth and maps here are clean. The same cannot be said for the pirate selling them.

choice.text: Buy a map of the sector.
Buy what the pirate calls an "Engine Overdrive Capacitor MK III+".
Nothing here is of interest. Leave.
Nothing here is of interest. Leave.

event.text: You aren't looking to make any black market deals.

event.name: STOREEVENT_PIRATE_AWKWARD
event.text: Pirates nowadays are just commonplace. Hell, if there wasn't a pirate here, you'd have been more surprised. Looks like the station here is a market of sorts, and they're open to trading with anyone.

"Uewh... Feds. You aren't here to arrest us, are you?" When you shake your head, the pirates relax and show you where they're keeping various crates of resources. Apparently, they won't let you trade until you've bought one.
As you're carting the crate back onto your ship, you notice the crate suspiciously bears the Federation logo! Where did this come from?

choice.text: Ignore it and move on to the store.

event.text: As you're carting the crate back onto your ship, you notice the crate suspiciously bears the Federation logo! Where did this come from?

choice.text: Ignore it and move on to the store.

event.text: As you're carting the crate back onto your ship, you notice the crate suspiciously bears the Federation logo! Where did this come from?

choice.text: Ignore it and move on to the store.

event.text: These scum are still outlaws, regardless if they're running a market or not. Time to bring their villainy to an end.
You aren't looking to make any black market deals.
"Oh uh uh er uhm uh uhhh uh er uhm uhhhh..." the pirate takes off and runs into another room, slamming the door behind him. You can't figure out a way in, so you head to the market instead.
Your hacking module opens up the doors, revealing the pirate inside. He surrenders almost immediately.
"Don't ask questions you don't want to know the answer to." You might have pressed further, but the pirate hands some scrap to you discreetly and walks away.
"You know damn well where we got them! And now, you'll be our next!"

event.name: STOREEVENT_PIRATE_REFUELING
event.text: A small platform orbits near this beacon - it looks like a fueling station of some sort, recently taken over by pirates, and it is cheerily broadcasting reasonable prices in a spectrum of frequencies and languages. This takeover must have been very recent...

choice.text: (Upg. Weapons) Approach with your weapons armed. Make it clear you aren't messing around.

event.text: Your show of force makes it clear you aren't going to take any funny stuff from these pirates. They open their store for you almost immediately, but don't offer any extra fuel...
As you prepare to leave the system, the station suddenly turns aggressive - apparently, pirates don't take well to being ignored!
You ignore the refueling platform.
You ignore the refueling platform.
Besides the fuel, it looks like the station also has a market.

choice.text: Ignore the fuel and head to the market.

event.text: Looks like after the attack, the platform was damaged. You can likely steal as much fuel as remains, though the pirates won't be happy.
You hijack the fuel dispenser, taking as much fuel as you can before the pirates catch you.

choice.text: Ignore the fuel and head to the market.

event.text: You dock and signal the fuel station's newest 'staff' to begin refueling.
As you dock with the refueling platform, there is an explosion from your engine room! Warning lights flash in your ship as pirates from the station swarm aboard your vessel!

choice.text: (Blast Doors) Seal your blast doors, one can never be too careful when docked.

event.text: Pirates hidden on the station are confounded by your security locks, turning an attempted ambush into a fish-in-a-barrel firefight. You take control of the station and take its fuel reserves.
You dock and signal the fuel station's newest 'staff' to begin refueling.
To your surprise, no trick ever comes. The pirates finish refueling, and once they're done you're allowed into the store.

choice.text: (Blast Doors) Seal your blast doors, one can never be too careful when docked.

event.text: Looks like there was nothing to be worried about. The pirates finish refueling, and once they're done you're allowed into the store.

event.name: STOREEVENT_PIRATE_SECURITY
event.text: You receive a wide-band automated message from a black market nearby, "Welcome to our humble trade depot and shipyard! All are welcome, but try any funny business and our 152 automated turret satellites will tear your ship to shreds!" Unusual for pirates to place high value in security, but you suppose it makes sense.
Some smugglers welcome you inside, and offer some less-than-legal services and goods.

choice.text: (Adv. Hacking) Hold the market hostage with their own turrets.

event.text: You remotely take control of all of the smuggler's turrets, and start firing on their ships. Once their entire fleet is crippled, they give in to all of your demands.
Without their turrets to defend them, the pirates are unable to defend themselves. At first you pretend everything is normal and shop, but as you leave you make it clear they're at your mercy.
The minute your weapons even come online all 152 turrets swivel towards you and open fire, causing massive damage to your hull. A smuggler vessel moves in to engage.

event.name: STOREEVENT_SHELL_BOWLING
event.text: A Shell market and arcade nearby is advertising itself as "Captain Strike's General Market and Bowling Gallery!"

When you step inside, you're greeted by a mascot-wearing Shell who claims to be Captain Strike himself. "A Renegade? Just my luck! If you ain't a square, thhhen you'll challenge me to a bowling match. Beat me, and you'll take home thhhe trophy!"

choice.text: Bowl with him, even though the fleet might catch up a little.
That's a waste of time. We'll stick to shopping.

event.text: The immature Shell makes a rude noise as you walk past and head to the market.
You flick on your weapons and engage the Shell station. Pffft, who even likes bowling anyways?
What kind of purpose does a bowling gallery have for a Federation vessel? None, you reckon.

You feel somewhat odd about bowling with sentient creatures, but the Shells don't seem to mind. They were genetically engineered for the task. Unfortunately... you aren't very good at this. Strike beats you every single time. "Tough luck, but you tried your best. Feel free to go shop or whatever it is you came here for."

I shall come with you, for you are a legend in the making."

event.name: STOREEVENT_SHELL_BIOLOGIST
event.text: Shells are fascinated by science, but independent scientists often struggle to fund their endeavours. A prospective biologist has set up a small market selling military goods for scrap, as well as a few of his personal projects.

choice.text: See what special things he has to offer.

event.text: The Shell perks up when you inquire about his other projects.

choice.text: Buy an External DNA Bank augment.
Buy a crew with synthetized memories.
(Shell Crew) Offer to hire the scientist.

event.text: Realizing this is his chance to finally go somewhere in his career, the Shell is more than willing.
The Shell frowns but says nothing more.
You have no interest in the Shell's special offers, but you will take a look at the military goods.

event.name: STOREEVENT_SHELL_MEDICAL
event.text: A Shell laboratory is set up next to a marketplace. The lab offers various services relating to medical systems.

choice.text: Switch your Medbay to a Clone Bay for extra cheap.
Switch your Clone Bay to a Medbay for extra cheap.

event.text: You're good with the systems you have.

event.name: STOREEVENT_LANIUS_METAL
event.text: You arrive to discover a number of Lanius ships docked at what appears to be a station. You hasten to leave but are relieved when they message you in your language. "Buy? Sell? Traders." It seems not all Lanius are unfriendly to strangers.
This is a rare opportunity, and you aren't passing it up.
"Free scrap, giving? Generosity. Overwhelm, watering of eye duct. Metaphor."
Despite the unprecedented friendliness of these Lanius, you've turned on them, and are now attacking!
To your surprise, one of the Lanius are so surprised by your kindness, they offer to join your crew!
It appears your kindness will not go unthanked. The Lanius offer you a weapon in return.
It appears your kindness will not go unthanked. The Lanius offer you a drone in return.

textList.name: TEXT_TONYS
textList.text: An advertisement appears on your screen as you approach, depicting a slim and well-kept Leech. "Hey there, I'm Mr. Senior. Tony Senior, that is! Owner of Tony's! I'd like to announce our brand new partnership with Hektar Industries! Come on and stop by!" You swear you've seen this ad before long ago. This definitely isn't "brand new", and "Tony's" is a massive retail chain. For some reason they're looping this same ancient ad, but that hardly matters.

Looks like the nearby station is a "Tony's", one of the only Leech-owned as well as the largest retail chain in the Multiverse. Besides the usual commodities, these stores are infamous for selling military goods suspiciously labeled as "gardening appliances".

Seems an advertisement from the local Tony's is playing over your intercom. Strange to find such a large retail chain offering military weapons, but considering they also sell second-hand organs and prostitutes, it's not that out of place.

"Hey there folks! Come on in and stop by your local Tony's! We've got uh... um... come on and stop by!" Despite the unconvincing pitch, you've heard of these places. Owned by a mysterious and elusive Leech tycoon, "Tony's" serves as the Multiverse's largest retail chain, and for good reason.

A Slug ship flies past but stops when they see you. Their captain half-heartedly hands you a flier advertising "great deals!" on Hektar-brand modular weaponry(tm) being sold at the nearby Tony's. The ship jumps away, but you figure the reputation of the Leech retail chain outcompetes the rudeness of the Slugs.
A passive-aggressive jingle plays on the stereo, broadcasting from the nearby retail store. "Come on to Tony's! Come on to Tony's! YOU. WILL. SHOP."

The bright colors and simple yet recognizeable logo of the nearby store brings back memories. The infamous brand of "Tony's" is known for a lot of things, some good, some bad, and some bizarre. A lot of strange myths are centered around its founder Tony Sr., from his involvement in the mafia to a dark past with Zulfiqar. You have no idea if any of these are true, but their stores are known for quality merchandise, and you figure it's worth a look.

choice.text: You cannot take out a loan at this time.
Just get what we need and leave.

event.text: You're only here for military supplies and nothing else. Let's just shop and get it over with.

event.name: STOREEVENT_TONY_LOAN
event.text: To your surprise, it seems next to the Tony's marketplace is the office of a loan shark boasting various offers. These could be useful, but you should be cautious of the predatory interest rates. Tony's might be reputable, but it is a Leech-run business. The only person who'd trust a Leech is the same person who'd trust a Slug.

The Leech running the office, who doesn't even give you a name, seems more than happy to give you some scrap. Too eager, in fact. By the time you've already signed your name, he only then informs you there's a 40% interest rate. He warns you to make sure you can pay off your debts, because you don't want to mess with "The Worm".
